intro: Oxytropis pseudohirsutiuscula, commonly known as the hairy filaree, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis pseudohirsutiuscula is often found in rocky or sandy areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
